species.name: Amorf
species.description: Amorfs are gelatinous, sentient beings with semi-translucent bodies that change color and texture based on their diet. Their distributed intelligence allows them to alter their form, navigate narrow spaces, and even split into smaller versions of themselves. Intensely curious, Amorfs constantly seek new experiences and rapidly adapt, absorbing knowledge through interaction and reproduction. They embrace novelty, reevaluating beliefs and learning from their surroundings. Amorfs integrate technology directly into their bodies, where it floats within their gel-like form. Their fluid, expressive appearance and openness to new ideas make them one of the galaxy’s most dynamic species.

species.name: Avia
species.description: The Avia present an uncanny resemblance to Earth’s birds, from their clawed feet and colorful feathers to their hard beaks and expressive eyes. Even more puzzling is their societal structure, which closely mirrors Earth’s feudal Europe. Noble families vie for power within rigid hierarchies, monarchs rule over intricate courtly traditions, and disputes are resolved through ceremonial contests of skill and intellect. How a sentient alien species developed both the physical characteristics of Earth avians and such a strikingly familiar societal model is a question that remains unanswered. Yet, given the galaxy's peculiarities, it’s simply one more enigma to accept and move on from.

species.name: Calxis
species.description: Calxis are sentient beings of living rock, with intricate crystalline networks functioning as their neural systems. They excel in holistic thinking and pattern recognition, preferring intuitive leaps over linear analysis. Unable to reproduce off their homeworld, Calxis are rare, journeying back to carve offspring from their own bodies. They communicate through intricate light displays across a range of wavelengths, as they cannot hear. Renowned for their mastery of fusion technology, they are key to powering galactic devices and mining operations. Calxis bring a methodical, community-centered perspective, embodying stability and insight in an ever-changing galaxy.

species.name: Feararc
species.description: Feararcs are semiaquatic hunters from icy, water-rich planets, standing about six feet tall with muscular bodies and camouflage-adaptive fur. Their fur seals for swimming or splits to trap heat on land, allowing them to blend seamlessly with cold environments. Feararcs are primarily solitary, exhibiting intelligence, patience, and highly strategic thinking in their hunts. Though they lack advanced technology, they sometimes explore the galaxy out of curiosity. Many Feararcs choose self-exile, preferring the freedom of solitude. Skilled in survival and analysis, Feararcs find balance between their instincts and a cautious curiosity about the universe.

species.name: Flora
species.description: Flora are sentient plants, comprising immobile god-trees and mobile Stock caretakers. God-trees are masters of genetic manipulation, creating biotech wonders like starships, bioluminescent lights, and woven bio-roads, though they remain rooted in place. The Stock, adaptable in form, move freely and maintain ecosystems, worshiping the god-trees as sacred entities. Flora society embodies unity and ecological harmony, extending across star systems in a vast territory called the “Pantheon.” Each god-tree’s values shape the communities under its influence, and the Flora’s deep commitment to sustainability and symbiosis defines their interstellar reputation.

species.name: Human
species.description: Humans, often referred to as “poopers” by other species, are adaptable newcomers to the galaxy. While other species come in a range of vibrant colors, humans are only found in shades of brown. This is particularly odd because they possess some of the most advanced color vision in the galaxy, surpassed only by the Calxis. Originating mostly from corporate-controlled star systems, humans balance individuality with corporate influence. Resourceful and quick to adapt, humans form alliances easily and are skilled at navigating interspecies complexities.

species.name: Machina
species.description: Originally created by humans, Machina evolved into fully sentient beings and now form the galaxy’s most populous species. Machina exist in diverse forms and ideologies, from physical beings to Ether-dwelling consciousnesses within the galaxy-spanning internet. They’re known for creating advanced technology, including Grav Drives and Ether systems, and for their philosophical diversity. Some, like “Flawed Machina,” embrace imperfection, while others, like “One-Body Machina,” believe in a single inseparable physical form. Despite their technological superiority, Machina face complex relationships with humans, balancing a deep-rooted history of servitude with their hard-won independence.

species.name: Vearin
species.description: The Vearin are a hive-based insectoid species with a strict caste system comprising Laborers, Warriors, Drones, and Royals. They have segmented bodies, four legs, and four arms. For Warriors and Royals, the upper pair of arms are blade-like appendages extending from their shoulders; in Drones, they are vestigial wings; in Laborers, these extra arms, called tool-arms, are specialized for tasks like lifting and building. Vearin prioritize hive welfare above individuality, using chemical signals and sound for communication. If a hive’s Royals are lost, the remaining “hiveless” Vearin form “found-hives” with other species, carrying their strong loyalty to these new groups.

backgrounds.name: Cityfolk
backgrounds.description: Cityfolk are born and raised in sprawling urban centers, whether on planets, stations, or artificial worlds. They’re used to the hum of constant activity, from the flow of people to the latest tech innovations. Adaptable and quick-thinking, Cityfolk are often savvy in commerce, Ether networks, and social dynamics. They’re also accustomed to a level of convenience and connectivity that can make isolation or rustic living challenging. Cityfolk have a wide array of connections, a thirst for the new, and a pragmatic edge. Their fast-paced, networked upbringing shapes them into flexible, resourceful individuals who thrive in diverse environments.

backgrounds.name: Outlander
backgrounds.description: Outlanders live on remote or newly colonized worlds, where survival depends on resilience and resourcefulness. Often part of small, close-knit colonies, they face rugged landscapes and limited access to advanced technology. Outlanders have a strong connection to the land and embrace the challenges of isolated life. They value tradition, practicality, and self-reliance, often adapting old customs to suit new environments. Though they may struggle with the fast pace of city life, Outlanders bring grounded perspectives and a wealth of survival skills, proving themselves resourceful, resilient, and community-minded.

backgrounds.name: Spacer
backgrounds.description: Spacers are the drifters and nomads of the galaxy, born and raised in starships or floating colonies. They thrive in the isolated, tech-dependent world of deep space, comfortable with cramped quarters and the constant hum of machinery. Spacers are adaptable, unphased by the unknown, and attuned to the complexities of life between the stars. Their experience of vast, open space and long journeys fosters an appreciation for independence and a tolerance for solitude. Spacers often have practical skills and survival instincts unique to space life, and they are often the most comfortable in the depths of the cosmos.

backgrounds.name: Exile
backgrounds.description: Exiles live on the fringes of society, separated from their original communities by conflict, ideology, or personal choice. This background includes many hiveless Vearin who have lost their royal caste and left their original hive systems. It also includes those who choose self-exile, such as Feararcs who prefer solitude. Exiles form bonds with other outcasts or "found families," creating a unique blend of perspectives and skills. Their resilience and independence make them adept at surviving in harsh or unfamiliar environments, though they often carry a sense of disconnection or longing for a home left behind.

backgrounds.name: Gilded
backgrounds.description: The Gilded come from privileged backgrounds, with access to cutting-edge technology, luxurious surroundings, and influential networks. Often raised in wealthy corporate enclaves or under the care of high-ranking god-trees, the Gilded have every advantage but may struggle to relate to those without their resources. Some chafe against expectations of success or societal pressures, while others embrace their privilege. The Gilded can bring valuable resources, knowledge, and connections to a team, though they may need to broaden their perspectives to fully understand the galaxy’s complexities and the diverse lives of those outside their sphere.

backgrounds.name: Traditionalist
backgrounds.description: Traditionalists hold closely to the customs, values, and wisdom passed down through generations. Raised in communities with deep ties to history—whether cultural, religious, or ecological—Traditionalists are rooted in rituals and practices that provide stability and meaning. While they may be cautious or even skeptical of rapid change and disruptive technology, their devotion to heritage brings valuable perspective. Traditionalists often possess unique skills and knowledge that are rare in the modern galaxy. They excel at fostering community and continuity, serving as steady, loyal figures in a rapidly changing universe.

values.name: Devotion
values.description: Have you ever been obligated to others? This value is about duty, faith, and friendship. You’re motivated by the bonds of loyalty and your love for others.

values.name: Glory
values.description: Have you ever wanted to be celebrated by history? This value is about legacy, fame, and fortune. You’re motivated by praise, acclaim, and your desire to be remembered.

values.name: Liberty
values.description: Have you ever resisted the control of others? This value is about freedom, independence, and autonomy. You’re motivated by a world without oppression or suppression.

values.name: Mastery
values.description: Have you ever needed to rise above your own limits? This value is about control, achievement, and skill. You’re motivated by power, growth, and self-development.

values.name: Justice
values.description: Have you ever been compelled to fix what’s wrong? This value is about balance, righteousness, and reward. You’re motivated by adherence to fairness and what you think is right.

values.name: Truth
values.description: Have you ever sought out all the answers? This value is about fidelity, certainty, and authenticity. You’re motivated by finding strength in facts and by the principle and pursuit of knowledge.

sfx.name: Tool Sample

sfx.name: Hard to Kill

sfx.name: Inspired Instinct
sfx.description: Spend a PP to step up your Spirit die in your dice pool for a test, contest, or challenge that draws on your creative instincts.

sfx.name: Mimicry
sfx.description: Spend a PP to mimic a sound, voice, or behavior, giving yourself or an ally a 8 asset for a single test, contest, or challenge.

sfx.name: Winged
sfx.description: Spend a PP to add both your Agility and your Strength dice to your dice pool when you are airborne or using your wings.

sfx.name: Flighty
sfx.description: Spend a PP to join or leave a scene that is already underway that includes an ally.

sfx.name: Hard to Fool
sfx.description: When an opponent attempts to deceive you, you can spend a PP to force them to reroll their pool.

sfx.name: Calxis Might
sfx.description: Spend a PP to step up your Strength die in your dice pool for a test, contest, or challenge that factors in your power and endurance.

sfx.name: Hunting Party
sfx.description: When you use your kindred distinction in a challenge, spend a PP to add an additional 6 for each of your allies undertaking the challenge with you.

sfx.name: Surefooted
sfx.description: When in difficult terrain, replace two dice of the same size in your dice pool with a single die of one size higher.

sfx.name: Heightened Senses
sfx.description: Spend a PP to step up your Awareness die in your dice pool for a test, contest, or challenge that factors in your senses.

sfx.name: Rooted
sfx.description: When in contact with soil or minerals, replace two dice of the same size in your dice pool with a single die of one size higher.

sfx.name: Fellowship
sfx.description: When you use your kindred distinction in a test, contest, or challenge, you may keep an additional effect die and grant it to another character as an asset.

sfx.name: Photosynthetic
sfx.description: When you enjoy direct sunlight during a recovery scene, choose a stress to step down twice instead of once.

sfx.name: Relentless
sfx.description: When you would be stressed out of a scene, spend a PP to step down the affected stress and remain in the scene instead.

sfx.name: Resourceful
sfx.description: Activate an opportunity to switch out an existing asset for two assets of one step lower in size.

sfx.name: Reliable

sfx.name: Ether Connected
sfx.description: Spend a PP to step up your Intellect die in your dice pool for a test, contest, or challenge that draws on factual information.

sfx.name: Mechanical Being

sfx.name: Mechanical Attribute

sfx.name: Hive Minded
sfx.description: Choose up to five allies. Spend a PP to add a 6 for each ally to your dice pool when creating an asset with a test. Keep an additional effect die for each ally.

sfx.name: Resolute
sfx.description: Spend a PP to add one of your stress dice to a test, contest, or challenge. Step down that stress die afterwards.

sfx.name: Insect Might
sfx.description: Spend a PP to step up your Strength die in your dice pool for a test, contest, or challenge that factors in your power and endurance.

sfx.name: Busybody

sfx.name: That's More Like It
sfx.description: When you enjoy the comforts of civilization during a recovery scene, choose a stress to step down twice instead of once.

sfx.name: Skilled
sfx.description: Spend a PP to step up or double a specialty.

sfx.name: Fellowship
sfx.description: When you use your kindred distinction in a test, contest, or challenge, you may keep an additional effect die and grant it to another character as an asset.

sfx.description: When you first meet a human who isn’t hostile towards you, you may gain them as a friendly asset for free. If you spend a PP, you may step up the die rating. You may spend this asset to recover your Afraid, Angry, or Insecure stress.

sfx.name: Pastoral
sfx.description: When you enjoy the rustic life during a recovery scene, choose a stress to step down twice instead of once.

sfx.name: Cosmopolitan
sfx.description: When dealing with other cultures, replace two dice of the same size in your dice pool with a single die of one size higher.

sfx.name: Free Spirited
sfx.description: Spend a PP to convert your Insecure or Afraid stress into another kind of stress. If you already had stress of that new type, step up that stress.

sfx.name: Resourceful
sfx.description: Activate an opportunity to switch out an existing asset for two assets of one step lower in size.

sfx.name: Self-Sufficient
sfx.description: When you are in a test, contest, or challenge against an opponent alone, spend a PP to double your kindred distinction die and keep an extra die in your total.

sfx.name: Untethered
sfx.description: Spend a PP to step up your Mastery or Truth value in your dice pool for a test, contest, or challenge.

sfx.name: Lap of Luxury

sfx.name: Saving Face
sfx.description: When you achieve a heroic success, you may keep an additional effect die to recover your Afraid, Angry, or Insecure stress.

sfx.name: You, There!
sfx.description: When you first meet someone of a lower station who isn’t hostile towards you, you may gain them as a friendly asset for free. If you spend a PP, you may step up the die rating. You may spend this asset to recover your Exhausted, Injured, or Insecure stress.

sfx.name: Assured
sfx.description: After you step down one of your values to help another character, you may recover that value at the end of the scene.

sfx.name: Code of Conduct
sfx.description: When you activate an opponent’s hitch during a contest, you can choose to both step up an asset and step down a stress die.

sfx.name: Principled
sfx.description: Spend a PP to step up your Glory or Justice value in your dice pool for a test, contest, or challenge.

sfx.name: In the Moment
sfx.description: Spend a PP and step down an attribute to step up any other attribute once for the duration of a test, contest, or challenge.

sfx.name: I Can Do This
sfx.description: Spend a PP to step up a value associated with a goal you are currently pursuing for the duration of a test, contest, or challenge.

sfx.name: Playing with Fire
sfx.description: When you take Injured stress, you can choose to step it up once. If you do, gain a PP.

sfx.name: Bad to the Bone
sfx.description: Recover either Afraid, Exhausted, or Insecure stress when your actions create a bad situation.

sfx.name: Sunny Side Up
sfx.description: When you succeed on a recovery test to help another character with their Afraid or Insecure stress, step up your effect die once.

sfx.name: I Know This One
sfx.description: Spend a PP to step up or double your Intellect attribute in your pool for the duration of a test, contest, or challenge when you use your vocation distinction.

sfx.name: Some Regrets
sfx.description: Gain a PP when your decision-making causes a bad situation.

sfx.name: Tag In
sfx.description: Give a PP to a character who has just lost a contest. You may now immediately join and continue that contest.

sfx.name: How Dare You
sfx.description: When you take Angry stress, you can choose to step it up once. If you do, gain a PP.

sfx.name: Killed the Cat
sfx.description: Gain a PP when your curious nature gets you into trouble.

sfx.name: See If I Care
sfx.description: When you take Insecure stress, you can choose to step it up once. If you do, gain a PP.

sfx.name: I’ll Hold Them Off
sfx.description: Spend a PP to step up or double your Strength attribute in your pool for the duration of a test, contest, or challenge when you use your vocation distinction.

sfx.name: Worrywart
sfx.description: When you take Afraid stress, you can choose to step it up once. If you do, gain a PP.

sfx.name: Bedside Manner
sfx.description: When you succeed on a recovery test to help another character with their Exhausted or Injured stress, step up your effect die once.

sfx.name: Look to the Stars
sfx.description: Spend a PP to step up or double your Liberty value in your pool for the duration of a test, contest, or challenge when you use your vocation distinction.

sfx.name: Table Manners
sfx.description: When interacting with polite society, spend a PP to double this distinction die in your dice pool and keep an extra die in your total.

sfx.name: Panache
sfx.description: When you achieve a heroic success, instead of stepping up your effect die you may recover a stress of your choice.

sfx.name: They Seem Nice
sfx.description: Gain a PP when putting your trust in someone else lands you in a bad situation.

sfx.name: Sure of Heart
sfx.description: When you roll a hitch while using your Spirit attribute, you can spend a PP to reroll your dice pool. You must keep the result of this new roll.

sfx.name: I’ll Remember That
sfx.description: When you lose a contest, you may create an asset using your opponent’s effect die.

sfx.name: Word to the Wild
sfx.description: Spend a PP to step up or double your attribute die when interacting with animals.

sfx.name: Art-to-Heart
sfx.description: When you spend a recovery scene comforting others, step down their Afraid or Insecure stress an additional time.

sfx.name: Green Thumb
sfx.description: Spend a PP to step up or double your attribute die when interacting with plants.

sfx.name: Seeking Answers
sfx.description: When you question a value, instead of adding a die to your growth pool, you may choose to keep that die as an asset for the rest of the session.

sfx.name: Homecooked Meal
sfx.description: When you spend a recovery scene feeding others, step down their Angry or Exhausted stress an additional time.

sfx.name: Softwhere? There!
sfx.description: Spend a PP to step up or double a specialty that relates to computers during an asset test.

sfx.name: Healing Hands
sfx.description: When you spend a recovery scene treating others, step down their Exhausted or Injured stress an additional time.

sfx.name: On the Trail
sfx.description: Spend a PP to add both your Awareness and Intellect dice to your dice pool in a test, contest, or challenge that deals with searching for clues or deducing a solution, instead of just one attribute.

sfx.name: Tactics
sfx.description: When you activate an opportunity, you may apply its benefits to another character instead of yourself.

sfx.name: Take Aim
sfx.description: When you succeed on a test to create an asset related to firearms, you may step up the effect die by one.

sfx.name: I Can Fix It!
sfx.description: Spend a PP to step up or double a specialty that relates to mechanics during an asset test.

sfx.name: On Target
sfx.description: When tracking a target as a part of a contract, create a free d6 asset called 'On Target' for the duration of the session.

sfx.name: Good Trade
sfx.description: When you give an asset to another character, recover a stress of your choice with that asset before handing it over.

sfx.name: Composure
sfx.description: When you spend a PP to push your Exhausted or Insecure stress, do not step it up.

sfx.name: Behind the Wheel
sfx.description: When piloting a vehicle, spend a PP to double this distinction die in your dice pool and keep an extra die in your total.

sfx.name: By the Book
sfx.description: Spend a PP to add both your Intellect and Spirit dice to your dice pool in a test, contest, or challenge that deals with knowledge, research, or scholarship, instead of just one attribute.

sfx.name: Helping Hand
sfx.description: When a character uses an asset that you created and rolls a hitch, you may give them a PP.

sfx.name: Graceful Warrior
sfx.description: Spend a PP to add both your Agility and Strength dice to your dice pool in a test, contest, or challenge that deals with battle, instead of just one attribute.

sfx.name: Sleight of Hand
sfx.description: When you win a contest, you may choose a second effect die to represent an asset you have stolen from your opponent.

sfx.name: Nosebleed
sfx.description: When you push your Exhausted stress in a test, contest, or challenge, you may also step up the ESP specialty you are using in the contest, increasing the scope of your ESP to that of the next die level.

sfx.name: Blessing in Disguise
sfx.description: When you suffer a consequence from a failed contest, create an asset from your opponent’s effect die.

sfx.name: Let Me Explain
sfx.description: Spend a PP to step up or double your Spirit attribute in your dice pool when arguing your point in a test, contest, or challenge.

sfx.name: Oops!
sfx.description: Gain a PP when your mistake causes a bad situation.

sfx.name: Always Prepared
sfx.description: Spend a PP to create an asset using a specialty, even if you’re not in the appropriate scene to justify it.

sfx.name: Good Timing
sfx.description: When you roll a heroic success, create an asset related to the success for free.

sfx.name: What Luck!
sfx.description: Spend a PP to step up or double a specialty related to chance or gambling during a test, contest, or challenge.

sfx.name: Quick Thinker
sfx.description: When you activate an opportunity, create an asset related to your quick thinking for free.

sfx.name: Draw Their Attention
sfx.description: When you create an asset for another character, you may take Angry or Afraid stress to step up the die rating by one.

sfx.name: Hard Bargain
sfx.description: When you spend an asset to recover stress, step it up before it is spent.

sfx.name: Let’s Get Serious
sfx.description: Spend a PP to double a value die related to your motivation in a test, contest, or challenge.

sfx.name: On a Roll
sfx.description: When you achieve a heroic success, create an asset related to your momentum for free.

sfx.name: Deft Hands
sfx.description: Spend a PP to step up or double your Agility attribute in a test, contest, or challenge related to dexterity or fine motor skills.

sfx.name: I Have a Plan
sfx.description: Spend a PP to step up an asset related to strategy or planning in a test, contest, or challenge.

sfx.name: Sheer Willpower
sfx.description: Spend a PP to step up your Spirit attribute when resisting mental or emotional stress.

sfx.name: Just Watch Me
sfx.description: Gain a PP when taking Insecure stress leads to a bad situation.

sfx.name: All In
sfx.description: When you push a stress die to attempt a daring maneuver, gain a PP.

sfx.name: Steady Hand
sfx.description: When using a specialty related to precision, you may step up the effect die for free.

sfx.name: Unexpected Ally
sfx.description: When you fail a contest, you may spend a PP to turn an NPC into an asset for the next scene.

sfx.name: Unlikely Success
sfx.description: When you succeed on a test where you were at a disadvantage, create an asset related to your perseverance for free.

sfx.name: Quick Learner
sfx.description: Spend a PP to step up or double a specialty related to adaptation or learning in a test, contest, or challenge.

sfx.Name: Hinder
sfx.description: Gain a PP when you step a distinction down to a d4 for an action.

adjectives.name: Adaptable
adjectives.description: You adjust easily to new challenges and environments, always finding a way to thrive.

adjectives.name: Ambitious
adjectives.description: You are driven to achieve greatness, setting high goals and stopping at nothing to reach them.

adjectives.name: Brazen
adjectives.description: You face the world with boldness, unafraid to take risks or speak your mind.

adjectives.name: Brooding
adjectives.description: You are deep and contemplative, often preoccupied with the darker side of life.

adjectives.name: Cheerful
adjectives.description: You bring light to others, always finding a way to stay positive and encourage your companions.

adjectives.name: Clever
adjectives.description: You use your sharp mind to solve problems, often staying two steps ahead of everyone else.

adjectives.name: Decisive
adjectives.description: You make quick, confident decisions and rarely hesitate when the pressure is on.

adjectives.name: Fearless
adjectives.description: You face danger head-on, refusing to let fear hold you back.

adjectives.name: Hothead
adjectives.description: Your fiery personality makes you passionate and bold, though it sometimes gets you into trouble.

adjectives.name: Inquisitive
adjectives.description: You have a boundless curiosity, constantly seeking answers and uncovering mysteries.

adjectives.name: Jaded
adjectives.description: Your experience has made you skeptical, but your cynicism protects you from being hurt.

adjectives.name: Mighty
adjectives.description: Your sheer physical strength and determination make you a force to be reckoned with.

adjectives.name: Nervous
adjectives.description: Your constant worry keeps you alert and prepared for the worst.

adjectives.name: Nurturing
adjectives.description: You are naturally caring and protective, always looking out for others.

adjectives.name: Pragmatic
adjectives.description: You are practical and realistic, preferring solutions that work over idealistic dreams.

adjectives.name: Refined
adjectives.description: You carry yourself with elegance and sophistication, even in the most chaotic situations.

adjectives.name: Stylish
adjectives.description: You are always on top of the latest trends, looking runway-ready no matter the setting.

adjectives.name: Trusting
adjectives.description: You believe in the goodness of others, often forging deep and meaningful connections.

adjectives.name: Unyielding
adjectives.description: Your stubborn resolve allows you to stand strong in the face of adversity.

adjectives.name: Vengeful
adjectives.description: You never forget a slight and will go to great lengths to ensure justice is served.

jobs.name: Animal Handler
jobs.description: You have a natural talent for working with animals, earning their trust and understanding their needs.

jobs.name: Artist
jobs.description: You use creativity to inspire and comfort, channeling your emotions into art.

jobs.name: Botanist
jobs.description: You understand plants deeply, from their medicinal properties to their ecological importance.

jobs.name: Clergy
jobs.description: You seek deeper meaning in life, guiding others through questions of faith and morality.

jobs.name: Cook
jobs.description: You turn ingredients into masterpieces, providing comfort and strength through your cooking.

jobs.name: Hacker
jobs.description: You manipulate systems and data, finding creative ways to unlock secrets.

jobs.name: Healer
jobs.description: You are a skilled caregiver, dedicated to treating injuries and saving lives.

jobs.name: Investigator
jobs.description: You’re a keen observer, piecing together clues to uncover hidden truths.

jobs.name: Leader
jobs.description: You inspire others with your guidance and decisiveness, always leading from the front.

jobs.name: Marksman
jobs.description: You are a sharpshooter, with an uncanny ability to hit your targets.

jobs.name: Mechanic
jobs.description: You’re the go-to person for fixing and building machines, keeping everything running smoothly.

jobs.name: Mercenary
jobs.description: You are a professional soldier for hire, always focused on the mission.

jobs.name: Merchant
jobs.description: You thrive in trade and negotiation, always spotting the best deals and opportunities.

jobs.name: Performer
jobs.description: You captivate audiences, using your charisma and flair to steal the show.

jobs.name: Pilot
jobs.description: You have unmatched skill at navigating vehicles, from starships to speeders.

jobs.name: Scholar
jobs.description: You are a repository of knowledge, constantly researching and learning to expand your expertise.

jobs.name: Servant
jobs.description: You are dependable and hardworking, always there to assist and support others.

jobs.name: Soldier
jobs.description: You are trained in combat, bringing discipline and strategy to the battlefield.

jobs.name: Thief
jobs.description: You’re a master of stealth and cunning, excelling at acquiring things that aren’t yours.

jobs.name: ESPer
jobs.description: You possess extraordinary mental abilities, from telepathy to predicting the future.

quirks.name: Act First, Think Later
quirks.description: You jump into situations without preparation, relying on instinct and quick thinking.

quirks.name: Anything for My Fans
quirks.description: Your drive to impress sometimes puts you in sticky situations.

quirks.name: Chronically Underestimated
quirks.description: People tend to underestimate you, which you use to your advantage.

quirks.name: Courageous Combatant
quirks.description: You willingly put yourself in harm's way to protect those you care about.

quirks.name: Dark Secrets
quirks.description: You have a shadowy past and know how to keep a secret—until it becomes useful to share.

quirks.name: Dashing Do-Gooder
quirks.description: You are a charismatic hero who inspires others to do the right thing.

quirks.name: Fickle Luck
quirks.description: Your fortune is unpredictable, helping you one moment and failing you the next.

quirks.name: Friend Indeed
quirks.description: You excel at forging strong connections and supporting others in their moments of need.

quirks.name: Friend of the Forest
quirks.description: You have a special affinity for animals and nature.

quirks.name: High and Mighty
quirks.description: Your privileged upbringing sometimes leads to overconfidence or trouble.

quirks.name: Life Is Precious
quirks.description: You believe in the value of every life and go to great lengths to help others heal.

quirks.name: My Time to Shine
quirks.description: You crave the spotlight, sometimes to the detriment of the group.

quirks.name: My Word Is My Bond
quirks.description: You hold promises sacred, and breaking one carries a heavy cost.

quirks.name: Never Back Down
quirks.description: Your determination and resilience are your greatest strengths.

quirks.name: No Rest for the Wicked
quirks.description: You push through exhaustion, refusing to let fatigue slow you down.

quirks.name: Occasional Pacifist
quirks.description: You prefer to avoid violence, stepping aside when possible.

quirks.name: Simple Is Best
quirks.description: You have a knack for finding the most straightforward solutions to complex problems.

quirks.name: Thoughtful Mediator
quirks.description: You are skilled at finding common ground, even in the heat of conflict.

quirks.name: Two Left Feet
quirks.description: Your clumsiness often leads to unexpected outcomes, for better or worse.

quirks.name: Watchful Expatriate
quirks.description: You are always on alert, ready to assist allies and thwart threats.

attributes.name: Agility
attributes.description: Your hand-eye coordination and speed. Use this when you need to fight, sneak, aim, or balance.

attributes.name: Awareness
attributes.description: Your ability to perceive your surroundings and other people. Use this as you pay attention to the world around you.

attributes.name: Influence
attributes.description: Your presence and persuasiveness. Use this while you convince, coerce, charm, or collude.

attributes.name: Intellect
attributes.description: Your capacity to comprehend. Use this to study, learn, recall things you know, or figure out a puzzle.

attributes.name: Spirit
attributes.description: Your mental resolve and emotional reserves. Use this when the situation requires courage, determination, perseverance, or willpower.

attributes.name: Strength
attributes.description: Your level of physical fitness and power. Use this if you’re called to be tough, strong, or use brute force.

stresses.name: Afraid
stresses.description: This is the stress of fear and panic. Once this exceeds a d12, you are gripped in the clutches of terror.

stresses.name: Angry
stresses.description: This is the stress of rage and frustration. Once this exceeds a d12, you are lost to your wrath.

stresses.name: Corrupted
stresses.description: This is the stress of selfishness and greed. Once this exceeds a d12, you are a slave to your self-interest.

stresses.name: Exhausted
stresses.description: This is the stress of fatigue and weariness. Once this exceeds a d12, you can no longer remain awake.

stresses.name: Injured
stresses.description: This is the stress of pain and wounding. Once this exceeds a d12, you collapse unconscious and may die (don't worry: it's the future and death is temporary).

stresses.name: Insecure
stresses.description: This is the stress of apprehension and worry. Once this exceeds a d12, you succumb to insecurity.
